message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of Natural Language Processing (cs.CL) because it proposes a model for generating sensational headlines without labeled data. Additionally, the paper uses a reinforcement learning approach, which is commonly used in NLP tasks. The paper also mentions the use of a summarization model, which is a common NLP technique. 

The paper could also belong to the sub-category of Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) because it proposes a model that uses reinforcement learning to generate headlines. 

The sub-category of Machine Learning (cs.LG) is also likely because the paper uses a reinforcement learning approach to optimize the model. 

The sub-category of Information Retrieval (cs.IR) is possible because the paper deals with generating headlines that capture people's attention and generate reader interest, which is related to information retrieval. 

Finally, the sub-category of Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) is possible because the paper proposes a novel loss function, Auto-tuned Reinforcement Learning (ARL), which dynamically balances reinforcement learning with maximum likelihood estimation. This approach is related to neural and evolutionary computing techniques.
